24.88.text: First in the spotlight tonight is Sarah Jane Bodell,

29.24.text: She's answering questions on the television series

33.12.text: John Savage is a salesman from Falkirk.

35.60.text: His specialist subject, the football manager Jock Stein.

38.68.text: Next, Wayne Stafford, a retail manager from Oldham and his subject,

46.32.text: He answers questions on the Suez Crisis.

59.96.text: Hello and welcome to Mastermind with me, John Humphrys.

63.96.text: Four more contenders are all set to take to the stage tonight,

67.76.text: or at least they hope they are all set.

70.20.text: An awful lot of revision goes into mugging up for the specialist round

73.84.text: but at least they have some idea of where the questions are coming from.

77.48.text: In the general knowledge round, they don't have a clue.

80.20.text: So that can be the real killer.

82.64.text: They get two minutes each for the first round and then

85.12.text: two and a half of the second.

86.80.text: The winner will claim the last place in the semifinals

89.92.text: and be on course to become the next Mastermind champion.

93.40.text: So, let's get on with it and ask our first contender to join us, please.

111.80.text: A Bit Of Fry & Laurie in two minutes, here we go.

114.04.text: The recurring characters in the first two series

116.92.text: include a spy called Tony played by Hugh Laurie

119.64.text: and his boss played by Stephen Fry.

124.12.text: In a series one sketch set in a restaurant,

126.08.text: what animal is presented alive as Stephen Fry's

128.52.text: main course to be prepared at the table?

131.68.text: During an episode in series two, Fry and Laurie claimed that a company has become

135.40.text: the show's new sponsor and in one sketch, Laurie's character is

138.36.text: made to kiss one of their products. What's the company called?

142.48.text: What do Fry and Laurie wear as a protest against censorship

145.52.text: in the introduction to episode three of series two

151.32.text: In the only episode in series four in which there are no guest stars,

154.36.text: Laurie replaces one guest with a pair of old trousers.

157.16.text: What does Fry replace the other one with?

159.28.text:
- Humbrol paint. 
- Yes, a tin of old paint.

161.12.text: What's the name of the contestant played by Carol MacReady

163.92.text: in a parody of the game show Countdown in which Fry plays the quizmaster

167.76.text: and Laurie plays the contestant Simon Sad?

172.00.text: In the first sketch of the pilot episode,

174.20.text: Fry and Laurie are under surveillance in an airport.

176.88.text: What word is repeated three times as the code

182.24.text: In series one, Hugh Laurie plays a song on the piano

184.84.text: dressed in a checked shirt and a bandanna.

187.08.text: The lyrics of the song consist of variations on the name of which country?

192.00.text: In a series four episode, Laurie has a bandaged head.

194.52.text: According to a video clip, which Australian actress caused his injury?

201.20.text: Anne Charleston. In Flowers For Wendy, Laurie's character

204.28.text: buys some flowers for his wife Wendy's birthday even though he is

207.72.text: warned by the flower seller they can bring out a what emotion in a person?

212.64.text: In series two episode six, there's a special tribute to Laurie

215.44.text: who has been accidentally killed by Fry.

217.92.text: When Rowan Atkinson speaks about him in the tribute,

220.40.text: whose name appears on the screen instead of Atkinson's?

224.12.text: In a sketch in which they sit at either end of a long table,

226.76.text: Fry repeatedly mishears Laurie's request to pass down what?

231.24.text: During a series four sketch parodying the film It's A Wonderful Life,

234.68.text: Fry and Laurie's characters hail a cab. BEEP

240.52.text: Is correct. No passes, Sarah Jane.

271.12.text: Jock Stein in two minutes, here we go.

273.20.text: Stein played for and managed Glasgow Celtic and was the

275.56.text: first manager of a British side to win the European Cup.

278.72.text: Which club did Stein leave in March '65 to take over at Celtic?

283.04.text: Which future Lisbon Lion did Stein sell cheaply to Celtic in 1964

286.92.text: for a reported fee of £4,000 while he was still manager of Hibernian?

292.68.text: Stein played for which junior football team of which his father was a committee member?

298.36.text: Who did Stein marry at the Gilmore Memorial Church

304.56.text: No, Jeanie McAuley. Who was the Celtic reserve team trainer

307.68.text: and former team-mate who recommended Stein to fill

310.16.text: Celtic's short-term need for a centre back in December '51?

314.64.text: Stein captained Celtic to which trophy in May '53?

317.32.text: After beating Arsenal and Manchester United,

319.96.text: they defeated Hibernian 2-0 in the final.

323.24.text: Whose dismissal as Scottish manager in '65 led to Stein

326.68.text: acting as caretaker manager of the national side for seven matches?

331.20.text: Ian McColl. In Stein's first match as Celtic manager in March '65,

334.56.text: they beat Airdrie 6-0 with John Hughes scoring the first goal.

340.96.text: It was Bertie Auld. Stein played for Albion Rovers from '42-'50.

345.04.text: Throughout this time, he worked as a miner in which colliery?

350.40.text: It was Bothwell. Which fellow manager said to Stein after

353.40.text: Celtic had won the '67 European Cup final, "John, you're immortal."

358.20.text: Stein was managing Scotland in a World Cup qualifying match

361.52.text: when he collapsed and died in September '85 at which ground?

366.24.text: How much was each member of the Celtic team fined

368.64.text: following a controversial world club championship play-off

371.60.text: against Racing Club in Montevideo in November '67

374.28.text: in which several Celtic players were sent off?

378.72.text: In 1972, at which club's ground did Stein dive in

381.76.text: amongst the Celtic supporters to remonstrate with them

384.80.text: for the sectarian singing of IRA songs?

388.92.text: During Celtic's 1970 post-season tour of North America,

392.24.text: Stein famously left the ground during BEEP

394.88.text: an ill-tempered match against which Italian club?

397.44.text: It later transpired that he'd flown home.

428.96.text: Stax Records, here we go. Two minutes.

431.04.text: Stax Records was founded in Memphis, Tennessee in 1957

434.04.text: and is renowned for R&B, blues and soul music.

436.60.text: What single by Booker T And The MG's -

438.76.text: originally the B-side to their single Behave Yourself -

441.56.text: reached number one on the R&B charts?

444.80.text: What was the original name of Stax Records, changed in 1961

447.84.text: because there was another label of the same name in California?

451.84.text: What was the name of the former cinema on East McLemore Avenue in Memphis

455.24.text: that was rented and converted into a recording studio

458.20.text: and a record shop to become the home of Stax Records?

462.24.text: The Capitol. The name Stax comes from the surnames of the brother and sister

465.72.text: who founded the company - S-T is from Jim Stewart. Who is A-X from?

470.12.text: Which guitarist's unsuccessful recording session at Stax studios

473.48.text: gave his band's assistant and driver, Otis Redding,

476.16.text: the opportunity to record two songs in the remaining session time?

480.60.text: What was the name of the gospel group signed by Stax

482.88.text: who became one of the biggest R&B acts of the first half of the 1970s?

486.44.text: Their hits included Respect Yourself and I'll Take You There.

490.52.text: What was the name of the subsidiary label whose first release in '61

493.96.text: was an instrumental called Burnt Biscuits?

497.60.text: Which duo's '66 debut Stax LP Hold On I'm Comin'

500.48.text: went to number one in the US rhythm and blues album chart?

505.08.text: Who was the Detroit music producer responsible

507.56.text: for several hits for Johnnie Taylor and others?

510.04.text: He was later head of the company's A&R department.

513.72.text: What was the name of the legendary concert

515.88.text: held at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum in August '72

519.00.text: that featured a host of Stax artists

521.24.text: and became known as the Black Woodstock?

524.48.text: With which at Atlantic Records executive did Jim Stewart

527.44.text: agree on a handshake, a record distribution deal

529.96.text: that resulted in the label losing ownership of all master recordings?

534.68.text: Which record company acquired the master tapes

540.40.text: What is the title of Isaac Hayes' four-track album of '69

543.72.text: which includes an 18-minute version of By The Time I Get To Phoenix

547.32.text: and 12-minute version of Walk On By?

550.76.text: Which former Stax in-house songwriter BEEP

554.08.text: was hired by Fantasy Records in '77 to relaunch the label?

560.96.text: No passes, Wayne. You've got 12 points.

591.16.text: The Suez Crisis was prompted by President Nasser of Egypt's

594.16.text: nationalisation of the Suez Canal in 1956.

596.64.text: Who was Secretary General of the United Nations during the crisis?

599.92.text: He worked to find a solution between Nasser

602.24.text: and the governments of Britain, France and Israel?

605.76.text: Which city guards the Strait of Tiran and the entrance to the

608.64.text: Gulf of Aqaba? Its capture by the Israelis

610.76.text: ended the Egyptian blockade of the Straits?

613.84.text: The British government hosted a conference in August '56 to discuss

617.28.text: the international response to the nationalisation.

619.88.text: In which building was the conference held?

624.40.text: Lancaster House. Who was the British Prime Minister at the time?

627.68.text: His wife said of the period, "For the past few weeks,

630.08.text: "I have felt as if the Suez Canal was flowing through my drawing room."

634.36.text: What was the name of the field marshal in overall command

637.24.text: of the Egyptian military forces during the crisis?

640.64.text: No, Abdel Hakim Amer. Who was the commander of the Israeli 202nd Airborne Brigade

644.76.text: during the crisis? He later went on to become Prime Minister of Israel.

649.36.text: What code name was given to the Israeli operation

655.16.text: Nasser declared that he would fund a building project

658.04.text: from Suez Canal revenues after America and Britain

660.68.text: withdrew their financial support in July '56.

665.92.text: What was the name of the Royal Navy ship that acted as the British command vessel

669.68.text: for General Stockwell when his land forces reached Port Said?

673.88.text: What name did Nasser use as a code word in his speech

676.40.text: announcing the nationalisation of the canal?

678.72.text: It was the signal to Egyptian troops to seize control of it.

683.00.text: Britain, France and Israel negotiated a secret agreement

686.08.text: in October '56 in which Britain and France

688.56.text: planned to free the Suez Canal zone

690.48.text: after Israel launched a military attack on Egypt.

693.24.text: In which suburb of Paris was the agreement made?

696.64.text: Which Soviet politician sent letters to the British, French and Israeli leaders

703.16.text: if Allied forces did not withdraw from Egypt?

706.72.text: On what date in '56 did British and

708.76.text: French paratroops first land on Egyptian soil?

714.92.text:
- Aidan, no passes. You have 11 points. 
- Thank you.

729.12.text: Well, a very close round. Let's have a look at the scores.

732.64.text: In fourth place, nine points, John Savage.

739.76.text: Sarah Jane Bodell and Wayne Stafford.

748.56.text: And it is the general knowledge round now

750.84.text: and if there's a tie at the end of it, the number of passes

753.64.text: is taken into account and the person with the fewer passes is the winner.

756.96.text: And if they're tied on passes as well, there will be a tie-break.

760.80.text: And the six highest-scoring runners up, incidentally,

763.84.text: will also be able to claim a place in the semifinals,

768.00.text: Let's get on with it and ask John to join us again if he would, please.

773.00.text: ..you start out with nine points, John,

775.48.text: with your knowledge of Jock Stein.

777.12.text: You get two and a half minutes for general knowledge, so here we go.

780.72.text: Which branch of medicine deals with children and the treatment of their diseases?

785.40.text: Which biblical prophet is played by Christian Bale

787.92.text: in Ridley Scott's 2014 film Exodus - Gods And Kings?

792.92.text: By what name were the 1950s singing sisters

795.16.text: Joy and twins Babs and Teddie collectively known?

799.24.text: Which republic in the northern Caribbean consists of the main island,

805.52.text: include The Island De La Juventud?

809.80.text: Which English rugby union club moved from High Wycombe

812.88.text: to the Ricoh Arena in Coventry in late 2014?

817.20.text: Wasps. Which actor and presenter best known for his role in the Blackadder series

821.16.text: began his stage career when he appeared in the original cast of Oliver?

826.72.text: What vegetable is called brinjal on an Indian menu?

834.36.text: To what animal is a poem by Robert Burns dedicated?

836.52.text: It's opening lines are, "Wee, sleekit, cow'rin, tim'rous beastie

839.76.text: "O, what a panic's in thy breastie!"

842.72.text: Who entered Parliament as the Conservative MP

844.84.text: for Witney in Oxfordshire in the 2001 general election?

849.56.text: Which member of the Royal family wrote the children's book

852.72.text: the Old Man Of Lochnagar with illustrations by Sir Hugh Casson?

857.40.text: Which geological period was named after the perceived division

860.60.text: of its rock strata into three units?

864.92.text: Triassic. What term for the conflict between the houses

867.76.text: of York and Lancaster is widely attributed to Sir Walter Scott

871.00.text: in his 1829 novel Anne Of Geierstein?

874.60.text: The kettle drum, a hollow metal hemisphere over which a skin is stretched

877.76.text: whose tension can be changed to vary the pitch is better known by what name?

882.60.text: The German publishing house of Baedeker is known for books on what subject?

887.44.text: Who is said to have asked the portrait painter Sir Peter Lely to

890.68.text: "remark all these roughnesses, pimples, warts, and everything as you see me,

894.56.text: "otherwise I will never pay a farthing for it."

898.16.text: Yes, Oliver Cromwell. Which satirical television series of the 1960s

901.44.text: was known by the abbreviation TW3?

903.44.text: That Was The Week That Was.

904.96.text: Which American poet and writer of horror stories

907.32.text: created the investigator C Auguste Dupin?

909.44.text: Widely regarded as one of the first private detectives in fiction.

914.36.text: Which organisation that looks after the interests of walkers

917.52.text: has its roots in the 19th century

919.68.text: and was officially founded on 1st January 1935?

923.68.text: Lancashire, Fife and Norwich are varieties of which songbird?

928.88.text: Canary. Who was the first Christian martyr?

930.88.text: He was stoned to death in Jerusalem in about AD 36

933.28.text: after being accused of blasphemy? BEEP

937.44.text: Very good general knowledge round, no passes.

939.80.text:
- You've now got, John, 26 points. 
- Thanks.

957.52.text: And...you start this round, Aidan, with 11 points.

962.84.text: With your knowledge of the Suez Crisis.

965.12.text: And 26 is the score to beat and you have

968.36.text: two and a half minutes in which to do it.

970.36.text: Which composers operas include the Magic Flute and the Marriage Of Figaro?

974.96.text: What is the common name for the group of birds, aka raptors?

978.04.text: The group includes eagles, vultures, hawks and falcons.

982.72.text: Birds of prey. The government department known as DECC

985.24.text: was established in 2008. The letters of its name

987.64.text: stand for Department of Energy and...?

990.88.text: In French cuisine, what is a dish

1002.44.text: Which choral group that featured on Paul Simon's Graceland album

1005.52.text: sang at the ceremony when Nelson Mandela

1007.88.text: and President de Klerk received the Nobel Peace Prize.

1018.16.text: In the words of the song made famous by Stanley Holloway,

1021.12.text: whose ghost walks the Tower of London

1023.08.text: with her head tucked underneath her arm?

1026.32.text: Mexico is bordered to the north by the United States

1028.72.text: and to the south by Belize and which other country?

1032.64.text: At the beginning of the 17th century, Sir Thomas Bodley restored

1035.76.text: and extended the library named after him in which English university?

1039.96.text: Which comedy actor played the cafe owner Rene Artois

1046.52.text: Gordon Kaye! Whose celebrated painting has the full name

1049.68.text: The Fighting Temeraire, Tugged To Her Last Berth To Be Broken Up, 1838?

1059.60.text: The 1935 novel Salar The Salmon, a chronicle of the journey of a salmon

1063.00.text: from the Atlantic to the stream of its birth in Devon

1065.96.text: was written by which author and naturalist?

1070.40.text: The guy who wrote Tarka but I don't know.

1072.12.text: Williamson. What two-word euphemistic term for the killing of civilians

1075.56.text: or the destruction of civilian property

1077.76.text: while in pursuit of a military objective came to prominence in the 1990s?

1082.60.text: Which song first recorded on the concept album Evita

1085.20.text: and later included in the stage musical of the same name

1088.00.text: gave Julie Covington a UK chart-topping single in 1977?

1099.60.text: What alternative name for the star Alpha Canis Majoris,

1102.92.text: or the Dog Star, comes from a Greek word

1108.92.text: Sirius! What TV sports presenter and former England striker

1111.92.text: once remarked that "football is a simple game,

1114.52.text: "22 men chasing a ball for 90 minutes

1116.60.text: "and at the end, the Germans win"?

1124.72.text: No passes, Aidan. You've now gone up to 19 points.

1138.28.text: And now, Sarah Jane again, please.

1149.32.text: and 26 is still the score to beat.

1152.60.text: Let's see if you can do it. In two and a half minutes, here we go.

1155.24.text: Blue, bowhead and sperm are species of which large aquatic mammal?

1160.04.text: Vaduz is the capital of which independent

1168.52.text: Lichtenstein. What term that means 'to this' in Latin is used

1171.36.text: to describe, for example, a meeting that's called in response to

1174.84.text: a specific need rather than planned in advance?

1180.24.text: famed for its inexpensive but high-quality paperbacks

1183.04.text: launched a division called Firebird Books in 2002

1185.84.text: that specialises in science fiction and fantasy?

1189.20.text: Who became the first female bishop in the Church of England in 2015

1192.80.text: when she was consecrated Bishop of Stockport?

1197.60.text: Which film won the Best Picture Oscar at the 2015 ceremony?

1200.48.text: It stars Michael Keaton as Riggan Thomson,

1202.72.text: a washed-up actor who once played an iconic superhero.

1206.68.text: What is the ancient secret language of India

1208.80.text: in which many religious and philosophical works were written?

1212.80.text: Which British group released the single Dancing In The Moonlight.

1216.24.text: It peaked at number seven in the UK charts in 2001.

1220.32.text: Toploader. In the Second World War,

1222.36.text: Operation Dynamo was the codename for the evacuation of Allied troops

1225.92.text: from France in May and June 1940 from which port?

1229.84.text: An allegorical painting of 1854 by William Holman Hunt

1232.92.text: depicts Jesus Christ carrying a lantern

1235.12.text: and preparing to knock on a door representing the human soul.

1242.76.text: What position formerly held by the newspaper columnist Matthew Parris

1246.20.text: did he say "feeds your vanity and starves your self-respect"?

1256.32.text: Which French composer wrote the Suite Bergamasque?

1258.92.text: Its celebrated third movement is known as Clair De Lune.

1263.56.text: What is the name of the British zoologist who wrote The Naked Ape?

1275.16.text: Morris! Which American general and future president appears in

1284.28.text: Washington. Which Italian bread whose name comes from the Latin for fireplace

1287.76.text: is made from pizza dough baked in squares or rounds,

1290.28.text: cut into slices and often topped with herbs?

1294.00.text: On TV and later in film, how are the immature sixth formers

1297.32.text: Will, Simon, Neil and Jay collectively known?

1301.00.text: A joey is a name of Australian aboriginal origin

1303.32.text: used particularly for the young of which animal?

1325.56.text: And you also start out with 12 points, Wayne.

1329.08.text: And the score to beat is still 26.

1332.08.text: So, you have two and a half minutes in which to do it

1335.00.text: and get through to the semifinals or not. Here we go.

1338.60.text: The name of which Japanese unarmed martial arts discipline

1344.84.text: Which musical instrument is depicted on the coat of arms of Ireland?

1348.84.text: Which Cardinal and chief minister to Louis XIII of France

1351.52.text: was known as L'Eminence Rouge as he virtually ruled the country?

1355.60.text: In which branch of ladies fashion does Philip Treacy specialise?

1359.00.text: His creations are regularly seen at Ascot and society weddings.

1363.32.text: In Oscar Wilde's play Lady Windermere's Fan,

1365.96.text: what is the name everyone gives to their mistakes?

1370.00.text: Experience. Which gunman and outlaw of the Wild West is the subject

1373.40.text: of a 1938 ballet by the American composer Aaron Copland?

1377.64.text: What name was given to the test taken by London black cab drivers to

1380.92.text: ensure they're fully informed of the most efficient routes from place to place?

1386.00.text: Koshari, a dish containing rice, macaroni, lentils and a spicy sauce

1389.28.text: is a staple street food in which North African country?

1393.04.text: Egypt. Which gas is dissolved under pressure

1395.24.text: into ordinary water to produce soda water?

1399.12.text: Carbon dioxide. Which French singer, later an actress,

1401.88.text: had a number three hit in the UK with Joe Le Taxi in 1988?

1408.00.text: the letters AONB stand for area of outstanding what?

1412.76.text: Which Belgian cartoonist wrote The Adventures Of Tintin

1422.68.text: men's defending Wimbledon champion to lose in the opening round

1426.04.text: since Manuel Santana in 1967 when he lost to Ivo Karlovic in four sets?

1431.60.text: Hewitt. What was the name of King Arthur's wife,

1433.80.text: described in early Welsh literature as "The First Lady of this island"?

1438.44.text: Who plays Henry VIII in 2015 BBC miniseries

1441.28.text: based on Hilary Mantel's novels Wolf Hall and Bring Up The Bodies?

1446.84.text: Damien Lewis. The cities of Cleveland, Toledo and Buffalo

1449.96.text: stand on the shores of which of North America's Great Lakes?

1458.24.text: do three children mistake a murderer

1460.36.text: on the run for Jesus Christ?

1464.28.text: Whistle Down The Wind. Which guitarist is nicknamed Slow Hand,

1467.44.text: apparently from the ironic applause given to him

1470.08.text: when he changed frequently broken strings on stage?

1473.92.text: Who was re-elected First Minister of Wales in May 2011?

1477.28.text: He'd initially succeeded Rhodri Morgan in that post

1482.72.text: Carwyn Jones. The wild clematis, often called Old Man's Beard

1486.52.text: is also known as Traveller's what?

1504.60.text: Well, it's not all that often that a person who comes last

1507.56.text: in the specialist round comes first at the end of the contest

1510.44.text: but that's what has happened tonight.

1512.32.text: Let's look at all the scores.

1513.84.text: In fourth place with 19 points, Aidan Loy.

1517.52.text: In joint second place, 22 points apiece,

1520.80.text: Sarah Jane Bodell and Wayne Stafford.

1523.24.text: In first place with 26 points, John Savage.

1538.56.text: Which means that John is tonight's winner

1540.84.text: and he claims the last place in the semifinals.

1546.04.text: Now, if you would like to be a contender in the next series,

1554.36.text: And you can follow us on Twitter...

1557.64.text: And do please join us again next time for more Masterminds.
